item.title: Turn off linum-mode when file is too big
item.dc:creator: Chen Bin
item.description:
It's well known that linum-mode slows Emacs when the file contains thousands of lines.

Here is the fix, using wc, 

(add-hook 'prog-mode-hook
          (lambda ()
            ;; turn off `linum-mode' when there are more than 5000 lines
            ;; use `wc -c file' for performance reason
            (if (and (executable-find "wc")
                     (> (string-to-number (shell-command-to-string (format "wc -c %s" (buffer-file-name))))
                        (* 5000 80)))
                     (linum-mode -1))))
